synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The mixture was heated at 70 °C for a week. Upon cooling to room temperature, colourless crystals appear at the toluene/ethylene glycol interface.

Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images of a sample after compression to 12 GPa reveals crystalline nanoclusters with lattice spacing of 2.08 Å, consistent with the [111] spacing of face-centred cubic copper.
Heating Cu-S-M9 to 400 °C under vacuum yields cuprous sulfide instead of elemental copper.
Pyrolysis of Cu-S-Ada under the same conditions as Cu-S-M9 also yields cuprous sulfide.
TEM of a Ag-S-mDia sample after compression to 20 GPa reveals crystalline nanoclusters with lattice spacing of 2.4 Å, consistent with the [111] spacing of silver.
